brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to evaluate the effectiveness of a family-focused and interactive intervention for reducing the sedentary behavior and increasing physical activity of the participants. detailed_description.textblock:
Lack of physical activity is a behavioural risk for non-communicable diseases. The World Health Organization (WHO) reported that physical inactivity and unhealthy diets are two of the four main behavioural risk factors that contribute to non-communicable diseases. Globally, people who are overweight and obese, particularly if these people are physically inactive. They are at risk for morbidity and mortality.
Hong Kong-specific data demonstrates that many people cannot meet World Health Organization targets for physical activity. The 2014 Hong Kong Behavioural Risk Factor Survey reported that, for the seven days prior to the survey, about half (52.0%) of adults aged 18-64 had not done any moderate physical activity. Overall, only 37.5% of the respondents met the WHO's recommended physical activity level of at least 150 minutes of moderate or 75 minutes of vigorous physical activity a week for adults.
There is emerging evidence of effective behavioral interventions to decrease sedentary behavior. Some studies focused on reducing screen time or active workstations that encourage standing at the computer . Others focus on increased use of stairs instead of lifts . These interventions used behaviour change techniques such as goal-setting and behavioural self-monitoring. As previous approaches have not shown promising results, new approaches are needed to reduce sedentary behaviour and increase exercise or physical activity.
The goal of the study is to evaluate the effectiveness of a family-focused and interactive intervention for reducing the sedentary behaviour and increasing physical activity of the participants. The intervention is to use the concept of zero time, zero money, and zero equipment (3 Zero exercise), which aims to get sedentary people to start exercising. The intervention aims to encourage positive and sustainable health actions among participants and their family members.
Need assessment and focus group interview will be conducted before program design and after conducting the training, respectively. Process evaluation will be performed to evaluate the process of each component of the program. Qualitative and quantitative assessments will be used to evaluate the effectiveness of this 3-Zero exercise intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Change in behavior on performing physical activity in relation to 3 zero exercise, mild, moderate and vigorous exercises
primary_outcome.description: Behaviors on performing physical activity in relation to 3 zero exercise, mild, moderate and vigorous exercises, will be assessed by outcome-based 3 zero exercise and physical activity questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in behavior on performing physical activity in relation to 3 zero exercise, mild, moderate and vigorous exercises
secondary_outcome.description: Behavior on performing physical activity in relation to 3 zero exercise, mild, moderate and vigorous exercises, will be assessed by outcome-based 3 zero exercise and physical activity questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in behavior on taking healthy diet
secondary_outcome.description: Behavior on taking healthy diet will be assessed by outcome-based healthy diet questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in attitude on performing 3 zero exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediate after training session, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Attitude on performing physical activity in relation to 3 zero exercise, mild, moderate and vigorous exercises, will be assessed by outcome-based 3 zero exercise and physical activity questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived ability and intention to motivate participants themselves and their family to increase 3 zero exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived ability and intention to motivate participants themselves and their family members on performing physical activity in relation to "3 zero exercise", will be assessed by outcome-based 3 zero exercise questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in participants' own health and happiness
secondary_outcome.description: Personal health and happiness will be assessed by personal health and happiness scale
Family harmony will be assessed by the sub scale of family well being scale
Endurance will be assessed through a simple fitness test called seated cycling

arm_group.description: The experimental arm (Arm A) is an interactive two-session programme and monthly mobile messages, which aims to reduce participants' sedentary behavior and increase physical activity by increasing their motivation and self-efficacy and knowledge of different types of easy movements (3 Zero exercises).
The attention control arm (Arm B) is a two-session programme and monthly mobile messages, which will present information on the benefits of "3 Mores": more fruit, more vegetables, and more fibre.

intervention.description: Two interactive sessions and monthly mobile messages related to 3 zero exercise
Two interactive sessions and monthly mobile messages related to healthy diet

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Parents with at least on child between 3 and 18;
2. Parents with at least primary school educational level:
3. Parents who can read and write Chinese.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. People with a serious health condition that might prevent them from participating in physical activity;
2. Parents who do not have a child between 3 and 18.
